CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Louisiana edition, February 5, 1944, pg. 20, reads: "LA Traviata Pleases Large Pittsburgh Crowd - A near capacity audience witnessed the National Negro Opera company's presentation of La Traviata at Syria Mosque, Pittsburgh, Pa., Tuesday night of last week. Lillian Evanti was the star and sharing honors with her was one of Pittsburgh's own,  Joseph Lipscomb.  The opera [illegible] under the direction of Frederick Vajda.  Part of the large audience is shown here."
TitMainTitle: Audience seated for National Negro Opera Company "La Traviata" performance in Syria Mosque with two balconies and coffered ceiling
